reviewText:
A terrible Wipeout clone. Decent music, graphics and gameplay out of a mobile game, absolutely no support for any kind of controller, and some of the worst keyboard driving dynamics I've ever had the misfortune to play with.
Weapons are pretty good, although there's one that causes a wavy screen and cuts your racer's power that is very poorly-implemented.

The AI is pointless, has no pathifinding ability around the other machines, and is faster largely because the player is forced to use a keyboard. The races are grindfests, since winning is almost entirely luck, but you can replay the 6-lap time trial for 3 points each time. Only 3 opponents means the tracks are largely dead, there is rarely any other vehicle around you to use your weapons on.

The graphics are passable. Very simple geometry and detailed, low-res textures give it an early 3D look. The machine designs look great and overall the handling isn't bad, machines are responsive and turn quickly. Nailing the apex is pretty satisfying, especially when you have a boost in your pocket for the exit. It would be easier and a lot more fun with analog controls.
The keyboard seems to like to ignore or lock input, resulting in a quick tap sending the machine hard into the wall. So you can be impressed for a while until you start racing hard, until you find deploying powerups through a turn will cause you to crash.

If you crash by brushing a wall, your machine will phase through it and continue out into space before respawning.

You will have more fun by running the 20-year-old Wipeout 2O97 in Dosbox, I guarantee it.
